fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using Automation for Jira, if you create a rule that has the *Create issue* action and select an Insight Custom field to be filled when the issue is created, even if your IQL is correct, the field won't be populated with any object. This will only happen depending on the trigger used, triggers where this could be successfully reproduced: Scheduled, Webhook and Issue Transitioned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up an Insight Custom field that references some objects
 # Create an automation rule, use the *Scheduled* trigger
 # For the action, use *Create Issue* and choose the Insight Custom field
 # Use an IQL to reference an object for the Insight Custom Field
 # Manually trigger the rule. The ticket created will not have an object selected.

h3. Expected Results

The ticket will be created with an object selected for the Insight Custom Field.
h3. Actual Results

No object is selected for the Insight Custom Field.
h3. Workaround

After the *Create issue* action, create a *Branch Rule/related issues* and select *Most recently created issue*, then add an *Edit issue* action to this branch and select the Insight Custom field. Add an IQL as desired.
fields.summary: Setting a value for an Insight Custom Field on the Create Issue automation action doesn't work

fields.description:
Currently email notification From me field contains by default the "Jira Service Management Widget"

But when customers send requests from Portal the name contains the Project name (and it's more useful).

Is it possible to change the From name in emails when requests send via Widget and use the Project name the same way as Portal?


Email when request from Widget:

!image-2021-09-29-20-00-44-427.png|width=647,height=296!

 

Email when request from Portal:

!image-2021-09-29-20-01-33-115.png|width=583,height=281!
fields.summary: Change "From name" for customer email when request created from Widget

fields.description:
Some fields, such as Affected Services, when viewing from the Customer Portal, displays all the available options when clicked. So the customer can see all the existing options and choose what fits best for that case: 
 !image-2021-09-29-13-25-42-970.png|thumbnail! 

But, the same behavior doesn't happen from the Agent View. The user has to start typing the desired value, and only then, its presented with the options. This is not ideal, since not all users will know what to type. So it would be great if they can see all the available options being displayed when clicking:
 !image-2021-09-29-13-28-26-803.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-09-29-13-28-43-653.png|thumbnail! 

----
h3. Ideal Scenario
 When an Agent clicks on the field, it will present the values as a drop-down field, so that he can scroll and see what are the available options to pick, without having to start typing first.
fields.summary: Display options for system fields such as Affected Services, Organizations at Agent View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the *Issue field compare condition* uses the Request Type name to compare its value against the one the ticket is using. This causes issues when comparing Request Types that have translations. More information can be found on ([AUT-1869|https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-1869])
h3. Suggested Solution

The full proof solution is to compare the request types with Id instead of name.
h3. Workaround

*Option 1*: Compare the ID of the Request Type using the *advanced compare condition* against the following smart value: {{{{Request Type.requestType.id}}}} (or {{{{Customer Request Type.requestType.id}}}} for older instances). The Request Type Id can be obtained at the end of the URL when editing a Request Type.

For example: [https://<instance>.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/<project_key>/settings/request-types/request-type/*<request_type_id>*]

 !Screenshot_081332.png|thumbnail! 

*Option 2*: Use the *advanced compare condition* in combination with *exactly matches regular expression* to match the Request Type names using a regex like (value1|value2|value3|...|valueX).

!image-2021-09-29-09-57-21-763.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue field compare condition should use the ID of Request Types

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
We don't have an end point to use for JSM projects to check the permissions of users. Using the Jira REST API endpoint /rest/api/3/mypermissions doesn't explain how some users have access to projects(Portal access as customers) 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an endpoint that would retrieve and point out portal access browse permissions if any.
fields.summary: Provide a REST API endpoint to retrieve permissions of users(including browse project permissions for JSM customers)

fields.description:
Hi team,

In the current design, the JSM subordinated Opsgenie can be only accessed by the "Alerts" tab on a JSM project or directly browsing the full URL, which is not that convenient.

Image without Opsgenie in other sites:

!image-2021-09-29-15-24-40-135.png|width=612,height=203!

With standalone Opsgenie in other sites:

!image-2021-09-29-15-25-42-157.png|width=593,height=334!

It would be great to make it available in the product navigation list for fast-switching between Atlassian products.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Display Opsgenie in the product navigation list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Customers that are automatically added to a project do not receive emails when selecting the project role *Service Desk Customers* in the Send Email feature.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make the project public by changing the *Service project access* to *Anyone on the web (without logging in)* in *Project Settings > Customer permissions*.
 # Create a ticket on behalf of an unexisting user. This will automatically create the account of a customer.
# Go to *System Settings > Send Email*, choose the project and the *Service Desk Customer* project role and send the email.

h3. Expected Results
* Email is sent to all customers from the project

h3. Actual Results
* Email is only sent to manually added customers.
** On Company-managed projects, these customers can be identified by going to *Project Settings > People*. They will have the *Service Desk Customer* project role.

h3. Workaround
* Invite the customers using the *Customers > Add customers* option.
fields.summary: Send Email does not send email to automatically added customers

fields.description:
When tickets are created by email, they use the subject line as the ticket summary.  This isn't always a great option:

 
 * Sometimes, we ask people to put certain keywords in the subject or at the beginning of the subject so that we route their ticket to the right place - like 'ORDER FEEDBACK' or 'STRIPE BUG' - but then this clogs up the ticket display and makes all the tickets look the same. 
 * Ticket titles often include Re:, Fwd:, and all their permutations
 * There are always those repeat offenders who constantly litter their ticket titles with "URGENT", "IMPORTANT", "NEED THIS TODAY", "SOS", "EMERGENCY", etc - and these words can trigger people to either do work out of order (basically allowing the users to dictate our priorities for us, when often an individual's priorities don't necessarily match the needs of the business) or, on the flip side, ignore tickets out of spite (hey, it happens).

 

It would be helpful to have a filter where we could enter these strings and have them stripped from the summary.  De-capitalizing all summaries automatically would also be nice also less important.   It might be easiest to simply provide an option to add regex substitutions that are applied (and you can either substitute with nothing or with, for example, lowercased text).
fields.summary: Filter for Ticket Titles

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some AWS regions are currently not available when connecting the AWS Service Catalog Account in the AWS Service Catalog for JSM Cloud app.

The regions are:

* af-south-1
* ap-east-1
* eu-south-1
* me-south-1

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the above regions as selectable options in the app.

h3. Why this is important
Users with their AWS Service Catalog on any of these regions are not able to use the app, as the app can't connect to these regions.
 
h3. Workaround 
No workarounds are available at the moment.
fields.summary: Add more AWS regions in the AWS Service Catalog for JSM Cloud app

fields.description:
*Current behavior:*

Configure SLA for a project in such a way that it should finish counting when *Comment: For Customers* is added. When Automation for Jira adds a public comment on the issue of that project, the SLA is calculated based on that comment as well.

*Expected behavior:*

The SLA should not be calculated based on the public comments added by Automation for Jira.
fields.summary: SLA should not be calculated based on the actions by Automation for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The "Last active" information for Jira Service Management portal-only customers is not available using the JSM API, only by manually exporting the customers from the User Management menu.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the "Last active" timestamp as a key/value pair in the response when calling the "Get customers" [REST API endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-servicedesk/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-servicedesk-servicedeskid-customer-get]

h3. Why this is important
Since the API doesn't return the "Last active" information, it's not possible to set up external automation that can keep track of active and inactive customer accounts. 
 
h3. Workaround
Manually export the portal-only customers by going to Settings > User management > Jira Service Management. The exported CSV file contains the "Last active" data.
fields.summary: Add Last active timestamp to JSM API response

fields.description:
h3. Summary

{color:#1d1c1d}The issue lives within the class {color}{{ObjectBeanAttributeComparatorBase}}{color:#1d1c1d} in jsm-cmdb-monolith. If the user choses to order by a User attribute e.g. {color}{{Name = mySearch order by JiraUserAttribute}}{color:#1d1c1d} as an IQL the issue occur because it is implemented with the knowledge that Jira is closed a.k.a as a server plugin.{color}
 {color:#1d1c1d}This comparator was never changed for the cloud and it can be clearly seen in the implementation there.{color}
h3. How To Replicate
 # Authenticate on the customer's instance.
 # Navigate to [https://\{customer.domain}/jira/servicedesk/insight/object-schemas/2?typeId=7|https://ccpo.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/insight/object-schemas/2?typeId=7]
 # Change to list view and try to sort by *Assigned*.

h3. Expected Results

Return OK 200 and able to sort by *Assigned*
h3. Actual Results

When trying to sort objects in list mode by the *Assigned* attribute (which is a Jira user picker), nothing happens. Checking the console, the request returns a 504.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Not able to order by assigned user throws 504

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the JQL "Approvals[Approvals]" = pendingBy("email_address"), it shows the tickets that are already approved by the current user.
The ticket only disappears from the list if all approvers approved the request.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # In the workflow for Approval request type, on the approval step - set "Consider approved after - All approvals"
 # Create a ticket that approval is needed for more than one approval.
 # One user approves the ticket.
 # Search for "Approvals[Approvals]" = pendingBy("email_address").

h3. Expected Results

The results show only what is pending by the user mentioned in this JQL "Approvals[Approvals]" = pendingBy("email_address").

h3. Actual Results

The results show the tickets that are already approved by the current user because the other user hasn't approved yet.
fields.summary: Filter "Approvals[Approvals]" = pendingBy("email_address") shows what is already approved by the email address

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When I take a screenshot on my iOS device and send it as an inline image to the email channel of a JSM project, the image displays as a string in the issue description or the issue comment.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Take a screenshot on your iOS device
 # Open Gmail, compose a new email with the above screenshot attached inline and send it to the email channel of your JSM project
 # Go to the JSM project and check the new issue that is created from the email you sent in Step 2
 # See that the screenshot is not present in the issue but only a string

Note: This also happens when you reply to a email to comment on an issue.
h3. Expected Results

The attached screenshot to display as a thumbnail in the issue description or comment.

The attached screenshot to display in the attachment section in the issue.
h3. Actual Results

A string is displayed in place of the screenshot in the issue description or issue comment.

The screenshot does not appear in the attachment section.

!image-2021-09-28-15-51-17-506.png|width=284,height=198!!image-2021-09-28-15-52-07-656.png|width=289,height=268!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inline screenshot images sent via Gmail displays as string in issue

fields.description: It would be nice to have a Cancel button when creating a comment in the portal view, so if we change our mind we can close the text editor and see the issue details/comments more clearly.
fields.summary: Add a cancel button when adding a comment in the portal

fields.description:
*Current behaviour:*

The *Portal customers* page on a Cloud site shows only the logs of when the customer was *Last active* on the portal. This exludes the customers who do not log in to the portal and create the tickets only via the email channel.

 !image-2021-09-27-19-54-38-190.png|thumbnail! 

*Expected behaviour:*

It'd be great to have detailed logging of Portal customers especially for those who do not use the portal for ticket creation.

*Workaround:*

Perform the export of all the customers and all the recent JSM issues to find the real inactive users.
fields.summary: Show last activity of a portal only customer

fields.description:
In order to strengthen the use of the Jira Service Management portal please consider to add the following configurable options to the portal landing page:

 
 # Link to other company resources like other SaaS or hosted services that are often used by the end users.
 # Add a configurable widget that shows 'known issues' so end user is aware these issues are already reported and bing handled and no new request or ticket is required 
 # Overview of actual high priority incidents and possible link to workaround or detailed information on resolution time and plan
fields.summary: Add configuration options to JIRA Service Management portal landing page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Removing the first project owner from the project results in an error that redirects to the deprecated Legacy Automation page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with one user
 # Remove this user from the project 

h3. Expected Results
No errors

h3. Actual Results
Error on the top right when browsing project settings that redirects to the legacy automation page which is deprecated. 

h3. Workaround
No workaround available at the time.
This issue doesn't impact functionality.
To clear the error please contact support.
fields.summary: Removing the first project owner from the project results in an error that redirects to the deprecated Legacy Automation page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a new project is created using "Shared settings with an existing project" and there is a Automation rule configured with a SLA in the parent project, in the child project, the duplicated Automation rule will still be configured with the SLA of the parent project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In an existing Jira Service Desk project, create a Legacy Automation like below
!image-2021-09-27-16-59-11-176.png!

 # Create a new project with the "Shared settings with an existing project" checked and select the project where you've just configured the Legacy Automation rule for
 # Go to the newly created project's Project Settings > Automation > Legacy Automation
 # Select the Legacy Automation rule that has been copied to the child project
 # Edit the When clause, notice that the SLA field has "Time to resolution" in it not "Time to close after resolution" (this one seems to intermittently happen)
 # Open the Network tab and find the request with the ID of the Legacy Automation rule, see that the When clause is pointing to the parent's project
!image-2021-09-27-17-19-09-440.png!

h3. Expected Results

The automation rule's When clause's SLA should be that of the child project.

The automation rule should run when a SLA breach in the child project.
h3. Actual Results

The automation rule's When clause's SLA is referring to that of the parent project.

The automation rule does not run in the child project.
h3. Workaround

Reselect the SLA in the When clause of the affected Legacy Automation in the child project.
fields.summary: Automation rule's configuration incorrectly duplicated when creating a new project using "Shared settings with an existing project"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Its currently not possible to add preset approvers in team managed projects

h3. Suggested Solution
Add ability to set preset approvers in team managed projects

h3. Workaround
Use Company managed project
fields.summary: Add ability to set preset approvers in team managed projects
Add JSON Parser feature in Automation

fields.description:
The customer portal issue view should automatically refresh when changes are made to an issue.

Currently, when an agent makes changes to an issue in the Jira, those changes are not reflecting/updated on the portal issue view automatically. The customer has to manually refresh the portal (through the browser refresh option) from time to time to view the updates.

This feature request is to build the functionality in the portal to refresh automatically when any changes are made to the issue through the Jira application by agents.

As a workaround, these browser extensions for [Chrome|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/tab-auto-refresh/jaioibhbkffompljnnipmpkeafhpicpd?hl=en] and [Firefox|https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/tab-auto-refresh/] can help to enable auto-refresh for a particular browser tab.
fields.summary: Auto refresh portal view when the ticket is updated in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cells copied from a spreadsheet get converted into an image when pasted in the JSM portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the _Attachment_ and _Description_ fields to the Request form
 # Open the customer portal > Go to create a new request
 # Copy a table from a spreadsheet (i.e. from Excel)
 # Paste this table in the _Description_ field

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should paste the table within the Description field.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA is attaching the table as an attachment (image).
h3. Workaround

There are two possible workarounds:
 1. Copy the table > Paste it into a text editor > Copy it from the text editor and then paste it into the _Description_ field in the portal
 2. If you are using Chrome, you can use the following combination to paste without formatting:
 - On Windows: Ctrl + Shift + V
 - On Mac: Command + Shift + V
fields.summary: Cells copied from a spreadsheet get converted into an image when pasted in the JSM portal

fields.description: It would be great to have detailed information in Jira Audit logs about who migrated which user from a portal-only customer account to an Atlassian Account.
fields.summary: Provide 'who migrated which user to an Atlassian Account' information in Audit log

fields.description:
h3. Description
At the moment we can only have one attachment field in a request type, in team managed projects.

h3. Suggestion
It would be helpful being able to add more than one attachment field.
fields.summary: Add more attachment fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Browsing the portal pages using the keyboard (tab and enter keys) generates the error "Not Found We are having trouble finding that. Check the details and try again."
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the portal (tested on Google Chrome)
 # Press "Tab" on your keyboard until the selection indicator finds the option you want
 # Press "Enter"

h3. Expected Results

The desired page will load normally.
h3. Actual Results

Page throws a "Not Found" error.

Here's a screen recording showing the error: https://share.getcloudapp.com/9ZuQnNBg
h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Error browsing portal pages using the keyboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "All" requests page in Customer Portal does not show requests created by others when the filter has set to "Created by anyone". The same tickets can be seen at the "Approvals" view, which confuses the service user.
h3. Expected Results

Tickets showing at the "Approvals" requests view should also be available at the "All" requests view
h3. Actual Results

Only a list of requests created by the current user appears at the "All" requests view.
h3. References to JSDCLOUD-10378
fields.summary: Show tickets from "Approvals" in "All" requests portal page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Updating the Jira user attribute in the existing/new objects doesn't reflect the value in the attribute. However, the change is reflected in the Activity section.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit an existing object with the Jira user attribute.
 # Enter a user in the User attribute, click Save, it gives an error "Something went wrong. Contact administrator"
 # Try saving again, it is Saved successfully
 # Check the Attribute value in Object.

h3. Expected Results

The User attribute should be saved without error and reflect its value in the object.
h3. Actual Results

Shows the change in the Activity section but no value is displayed for the attribute.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Updating Jira user attribute in the existing/new objects doesn't reflect the value in the attribute.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a new ticket comes in, the queue count does not get updated until the user opens the queue itself.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the *All Open* queue
 # Monitor the queue count for all other queues on the sidebar
 # Create a new ticket
 # Check the queue counts

h3. Expected Results

The queue counts gets updated after around 1 - 2 min.
h3. Actual Results

Only the queue count of the open queue gets updated and the rest doesn't.

Video displaying the behavior:

- [^queue count not updating.mov]
h3. Workaround

Refresh the browser or access the other queues for the count to update.
fields.summary: Queue counters are not being refreshed
Ability to update Customer Request type via Automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Articles created in the personal space are not showing up in Service Desk Portal
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create articles in your personal space
 # Link the personal space in a service project
 # In portal, try to find that article - it will not show up
 # Articles from that space also do not show up in the KB Hub page.

h3. Expected Results

Articles created in the personal space which do not have any restriction should be shown in the portal
h3. Actual Results

Articles created in the Personal Space are not shown in the portal
h3. Workaround

create similar articles in some other space and link it with the Service Project
fields.summary: Articles from a linked personal space are not showing up in Portal and KB Hub

fields.description:
h3. Description
The old issue view by default does not display a custom field if empty. On the new issue view, we can configure to [hide fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configure-field-layout-in-the-issue-view-961798059.html#Configurefieldlayoutintheissueview-Hidewhenempty] when empty, but if the field is available for the customer on the form we can't hide that field if empty.
 !fields.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
Would be nice to have the option to hide the fields in case they are empty even if they are displayed in the portal
fields.summary: Add the option to hide empty field values for fields available at the customer portal

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
This issue is not a bug. 
 For more information about the request language behavior, please check this post in Community:
 - [How to set Request Language for requests created with the REST api|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management/How-to-set-Request-Language-for-requests-created-with-the-REST/qaq-p/1801609]{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

When creating issues via API, the request language is not set as the project default. 

Even if the profile language of the requester, the project, and the Jira instance is set to any other than English, the Request language is always set to English.

Tested using a customer account creating a ticket via API and it also doesn’t work, but the customer notification uses the project default correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the project default language (and any other setting like the system *Indexing language* and *Default language*).
 # Change your profile language.
 # Raise a request via API.

h3. Expected Results

The request language will be set as the default project language.
h3. Actual Results

The request language will be set as English.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When creating issues via API, request language is always set to English

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The SLA configuration page will break if any of the SLA goals has a "\u001f" character

 !image-2021-09-21-10-52-38-621.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit an existing SLA goal.
 # Add a non UTF-8 character to the Goal's JQL. (example: "Request Type")
 # Save the Goal and the SLA rule.
 # Refresh the page.

GIF of the error being replicated. The extra space before the "Request Type" is a "\u001f" character.

- https://share.getcloudapp.com/KouJRvvx

h3. Expected Results

Jira reports an error and prevents the SLA from being saved.
h3. Actual Results

Despite the error on the screen, the goal is successfully saved and the SLA page breaks.

h3. Workaround

Delete the broken SLA via REST API:
{code:java}
curl -D- -X DELETE -u 'user:pass' https://site.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/agent/<PROJECT-KEY>/sla/metrics/<SLA-ID>{code}
fields.summary: Adding a "\u001f" character to an SLA JQL goal causes the SLA page to break.

fields.description:
*Problem:*
Currently there is no option to sort the portal by project name.

*Suggestion*:
To add an option to choose the request created by project name to improve the customer search and visualization.
fields.summary: Sort the portal requests by project name

fields.description:
When a Responder is added to a Jira ticket, the issue history shows the Responder Atlassian Account ID, instead of the User Name.
Opening this Feature Request to display the User Name of the Responder in the Issue History when a Responder is added.
fields.summary: Responder Names in Jira Issue History

fields.description:
At the moment when you want to use automation *Create Service Request* you are unable to copy *Reporter/Raise this request on behalf of* field like you can do with *Approver, Summary or Description* (just a few examples). 

This is already available in Create/Clone Jira Issue
fields.summary: Ability to copy "raise this request on behalf of" from current issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

SLA goals doesn't obey 'Stop' condition if workflow is changed on the issue and changes are made on the SLA Condition (E.g: More items are added to the 'Stop' condition). This results in the SLA timer that keeps ticking over although the 'Stop' condition is met for the issue,

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a SLA goal to stop on comment to customer (Exclude 'Entered status: In Progress')
# Create an issue and transition to 'In progress'
# Close the issue. The SLA should *not* stop at this point
# Change the issue type and workflow of the issue
# Update the SLA configuration to include 'Entered status: In Progress'
# Run a SLA reconstruction: [SLAs in Jira Service Desk Cloud are missing or disappear|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/slas-in-jira-service-desk-disappear-954252774.html]

h3. Expected Results
The SLA should be recalculated and show correctly. In the above scenario, the SLA should have stop counting when the ticket was transition to 'In progress'

h3. Actual Results

The SLA was not updated correctly and still shows as 'Running'

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: SLA goals doesn't obey 'Stop' condition if workflow is changed on the issue and SLA condition is changed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User exported schema from insight cloud app and tried to import it via object schema import.

It failed to analyze the file.

Please see: [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-686462?error=login_required&error_description=Login+required&state=c488bd3e-6265-4c57-bb82-547c719673d3&state=991e4b3e-fae1-4bc9-aa84-9e2b7d755fb7]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export a schema from insight cloud app. Schema file must be large ~ 1MB
 # Import it via object schema import in Insight

h3. Expected Results

The file would be able to be analyzed and the next step of importing would be available to the user
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
   stack_trace: java.io.IOException: Zip bomb detected! The file would exceed the max size of the expanded data in the zip-file. This may indicates that the file is used to inflate memory usage and thus could pose a security risk. Counter: 1048622, compressed size: 1, entry: 8f75a773-ca81-43c7-9234-c16aa899670d/schema.xml at com.atlassian.jsm.cmdb.imports.schema.utils.ZipSecureUtil.bytesRead(ZipSecureUtil.kt:14) at com.atlassian.jsm.cmdb.imports.schema.utils.ZipUtils$Companion.expandFromStream(ZipUtils.kt:51) at com.atlassian.jsm.cmdb.imports.schema.utils.ZipUtils$Companion.filteredExpand(ZipUtils.kt:25) at com.atlassian.jsm.cmdb.imports.schema.service.SchemaMetadataServiceImpl.getSchemasMetaData(SchemaMetadataService.kt:32) at com.atlassian.jsm.cmdb.imports.schema.service.SchemaImportConfigurationValidatorImpl.validateSchemaConfiguration(SchemaImportConfigurationValidator.kt:71) at com.atlassian.jsm.cmdb.imports.schema.ImportSchemaResource$validateSchemaConfigurationAsync$1.invokeSuspend(ImportSchemaResource.kt:107) at kotlin.coroutines.jvm.internal.BaseContinuationImpl.resumeWith(ContinuationImpl.kt:33) at kotlinx.coroutines.DispatchedTask.run(DispatchedTask.kt:106) at kotlinx.coroutines.scheduling.CoroutineScheduler.runSafely(CoroutineScheduler.kt:571) at kotlinx.coroutines.scheduling.CoroutineScheduler$Worker.executeTask(CoroutineScheduler.kt:750) at kotlinx.coroutines.scheduling.CoroutineScheduler$Worker.runWorker(CoroutineScheduler.kt:678) at kotlinx.coroutines.scheduling.CoroutineScheduler$Worker.run(CoroutineScheduler.kt:665)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Schema import zips with schema files greater than 1MB fail to import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When searching for request types in the help center, typing keywords could cause the search to show results for non-existing projects of the site
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the customer portal
# Search for multiple keywords (eg: 'sof')

h3. Expected Results
Only show results for projects of the site
h3. Actual Results
The result shows projects that doesn't exist on the site.
Upon click on the request type, the correct project would be selected

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Search in help center display project names that does not exist on the site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Setting "Anyone" for "Add Comment" permission without given "Browse Project" permission allowing "Portal Customer" add a comment to JIRA Business project via email. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a customer account
 # Create business project type
# Set Public for "Add Comment" permission
# Then , create a new issue.
# Then , send an email from the customer account email with the new issuekey as email subject

h3. Expected Results
The email will not be added as comment.

h3. Actual Results
The email added as comment.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Setting "Anyone" for "Add Comment" permission without given "Browse Project" permission allowing "Portal Customer" add a comment to JIRA Business project via email

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment , there are no way for admin to set public holiday in Opsgenie schedule. It will be hard for admin to manually configure the schedule.


h3. Suggestion
Have option for admin to set public holiday or import the public holiday.

h3. Workaround
Manually configure the schedule for the public holiday
fields.summary: Ability to import public holiday information in Opsgenie

fields.description: It would good to be able to send the satisfaction email from with in Automation. This would add a level of flexibility to that functionality
fields.summary: Send JSD satisfaction email via Automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "All" requests page in Customer Portal does not show requests created by others when the filter has set to "Created by anyone".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Help Centre
 # Raise a request on behalf of another user, along with as the requester is not you
 # Select "Requests" on the top right corner
 # Select "All" from the dropdown
 # Set the filter to be "Created by anyone"
 # See that your recently created request is not there

h3. Expected Results

A list of requests including the one created in Step 2 to appears.
h3. Actual Results

Only a list of requests created by the current user appeared.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
h3. References to suggestion JSDCLOUD-10395
fields.summary: "All" request page only shows requests created by current user

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, "Request Resolved" report only count article linked in the public comment as issue resolved with an article. For article linked in internal comment shall not be counted as resolved with an article 

h3. Suggestion
Include article linked in internal comment as issue resolved with an article.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: "Request Resolved" report also counts article linked in Internal Comment
"having user("currentReporter()")" filter issue scope IQL does not work for unlicensed Atlassian Accounts

fields.description:
Hello Atlassian,

What I would like to achieve is to have a "read-only" access for tickets in the customer portal for certain users, while having a "Create issue" right for others.
There is no possibility currently to achieve this currently with your product.

Since permissions  currently set (by default) as Mandatory consist of this:

Mandatory permissions:
 * Create Issues (Customers can create requests and view requests they have submitted via the customer portal)
 * Browse Projects (Customers can access the project in the customer portal)
 * Add Comments (Customers can comment on their requests.)

And the recommended permissions consist of:

 ** Create Attachments (Customers can add attachments to their requests)
 ** Assign Issue (This permission is mandatory for the *Assignee* field to work. The *Assignee* field is an optional hidden field and it automatically channels issues to certain team members.)


I suggest that you implement the possibility to fully customize the permissions for the role service desk customer.
fields.summary: Customizeable permissions for Service Desk Customers

fields.description:
Hello Atlassian team,


I would like to suggest that you implement the possibility for Service Desk customers to export all of their tickets in their respective Service Desk customer portal.

 Me and my colleagues feel that it is very basic feature that other support tools offer out of the box.

I am aware there is an add on that is available for this in the marketplace, however once again it is a really basic feature that should be available out of the box.


Kind regards,
Matija Jesih
fields.summary: Service Desk Customer role possibility to export all tickets from portal

fields.description: When customers are filling in long application forms and they have missed a mandatory field when they click submit they wont see the red outlines on the field that needs updating. Is it possible to get an alert near the submit button stating that the form has not been submitted due to missing information.
fields.summary: Adding a warning when adding an application if a mandatory field is empty

fields.description:
h3. *Current behavior*

On Jira Service Management we are now able to add a message to the login page, but the “Welcome” login page (the sign-up page) is still not customizable.  

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-330
h3. *Suggestion*

Add the ability to also edit the signup page and edit “You're almost there. We just need to grab a password so you can log in later.”.  

!Screen Shot 2021-09-15 at 17.29.19.png|width=308,height=343!
fields.summary: Further customization of the login page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching for JSM customer (ie. In Request participant field) takes longer time if they have big user base.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have 80k+ JSM customers in a site
# Attempt to search for one of the JSM customer

h3. Expected Results

The result should be returned within a few seconds

h3. Actual Results

The search takes more than 12 seconds to return the result

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Searching for JSM customer takes longer time if they have big userbase

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching for a user using email address in Request Participant field doesn't work. Previous FR:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-8834

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open an issue from Agent view (not portal)
# Search for existing JSM customer using their email address

h3. Expected Results

The user is returned from the search
h3. Actual Results

The user is Not returned from the search

h3. Workaround

Use their display name to search
fields.summary: Searching for a user using email address in Request Participant doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:

Workload Report in Service Desk Project timing out to load the issues. Workload report error on the large amount (usually > 2k) of unresolved issues in one service project.

Error message: There was a problem when searching for workloads. Please wait a moment, then try again"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Service project > Reports > click on Workload report 

         !Screenshot 2021-09-15 at 11.15.33 AM.png|width=369,height=224!          

     2. Execute the below JQL list all the unresolved issues in the customer instance  
{code:java}
project = ABC AND statusCategory!=Done order by updated DESC
{code}
    3. Export the issues to Google sheet to check the count of the unresolved issues.
h3. Expected Result

Workload report page loads successfully.
h3. Actual Result

Workload report timeout with error message"There was a problem when searching for workloads. Please wait a moment, then try again"
h3. Workaround:
 * Use the search in the workload page to narrow the search space for issues
 * Analyze unresolved issues and use the bulk transition to resolve any issues that may not have been properly marked as such.
fields.summary: Workload Report in Service Project timing out

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an issue is viewed on a mobile browser, if the issue contains Insight fields, these field does not show up on the mobile view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an Insight field to the 'View' screen for an issue.
 # Open an issue that contains the Insight field on a mobile browser 

h3. Expected Results
The Insight field shows up on the issue view and can be edited.

h3. Actual Results

The Insight field does not show on the issue. Instead, a red exclamation mark is shown with an error saying Insight is not available on the Jira instance (although it is)

 !File.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Switch to desktop mode to view the issue on the mobile browser.
fields.summary: Insight fields are not supported on Jira Mobile view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you create a service desk on the portal of type 'Onboard new employees' you can fill out the Employee start date field. But when you view the request in the JSM project, you cannot see that field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSM company-managed project using the ITSM service management template
 # From the customer portal create a request of type 'Onboard new employees' filling out the 'Employee start date' field
 # Open the request in the JSM project
 # You cannot see the Employee start date field even if you expand More fields

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to see any fields you complete on the portal in the request in JSM.
h3. Actual Results

You cannot see the field in JSM
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: After creating an 'Onboard new employees' request on the portal one of the fields is not visible in JSM

fields.description:
Ability to add Inisght object fields in Team-managed projects.

Currently, it is only available for Company-managed projects.
fields.summary: Add Insight object fields for team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using *Ticket Category* JQL can cause performance problems on instances with lots of [entity properties|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-entity-properties/].  A tenant is likely to have lots of entity properties if it has the following addons installed:
*  [JQL Search Extensions for Jira - the JQL extensions|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214791/jql-search-extensions-for-jira-reports?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] 
* [ScriptRunner for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6820/scriptrunner-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]

Queues created under ITSM Categories in a project created from Jira Service Management ITSM Project template are using *Ticket Category* JQL by default so it will likely to be impacted by this performance issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

N/A
h3. Expected Results

JQL Performance should be OK and not have any impact on Jira.
h3. Actual Results

Due to poor JQL performance, larger instances may suffer from performance decrease.
h3. Workaround
- Replace *"Ticket category" = ...* JQL with *"Customer Request Type" in (...)*,  request types should be the ones that are assigned to the ITSM category you want.
- Delete all the ITSM category Queues,  if you want the same functionality,  create queues under *Queues* section instead, and match issues using *"Customer Request Type" in (...)* JQL mentioned in above step.
fields.summary: Using Ticket Category JQL(ie. "Ticket category" = "Service requests") may lead to performance problems

fields.description:
This is regarding the German translation of the "Written Feedback" screen of the customer satisfaction survey if they gave us a rating (please see screen3.png) The German translation (marked red in the screenshot) can be interpreted that we will not process any further request from our customer if they do not leave a comment.

Attachments:

screen_1.jpg (English translation)

screen_2.jpg (German translation).

The misleading part of the German text is "..., damit mir weitermachen können!".
fields.summary: Incorrect German Translation in  'Written Feedback" screen

fields.description:
Currently, you can only select either "Popularity" or "Alphabetical" to sort the projects in help center. It would be nice to be able to do a drag-and-drop reorder for all projects like you can do for projects in "Features" list.
The features needed are as follows:
* Ability to sort projects at will
* Ability to categorize projects (please see the attachment below)
 !AtlassianSupport 2021-09-14 12.12.03.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: More flexible display of projects in help center

fields.description: Currently, we can add only 15 projects to “Featured” list in help center. It would be nice if we could add more projects to "Featured" would be better because projects that are not in “Featured” are collapsed and a bit hard to find them.
fields.summary: Remove the limit on the number of projects that can be added to "Features" in help center

fields.description:
h3. *Current behavior*

Currently, when accessing the change calendar, the default view is *Week* and even changing to *Day* or *Month*, when refreshing the page, it will revert back to *Week*.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add the ability for project administrators to select the default view for the change calendar.
fields.summary: Ability to set the default view for Change Calendar

fields.description:
h4. Current behavior

Raise on behalf of (*Reporter*) field uses the following API endpoint:
 - rest/api/1.0/users/picker

This endpoint does not have filters and will show every active user on the instance/site.
h4. Suggestion

Add a filter on this API endpoint to show only users that have access to the respective project.
fields.summary: Filter raise on behalf of option to show only customers that have access to the project

fields.description:
*Problem*
We don't connect all our Customers in the Portal with connected Services that customers can request help on. But we filter on the domain and/or the Organization name. But right now we can just filter on personal level of the Reporter (uid/displayName)

*Suggestion:*
Extend the functionality to be able to filter on Reporter e-mail domain or organisation.

Right now you can filter on userKey or displayName in the connection with Insight.

*Current functionality:*
[https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/configure-the-insight-object-field/#Filter-using-system-fields-from-within-the-issue|http://example.com/]
fields.summary: Extend the functionality to be able to filter on Reporter

fields.description: When clicking on the blue "Create" tab, I would like to be able to select the "Status" field (so I can change the status before I create the ticket).
fields.summary: Ability to select "Status" field in the "Create Issue" window

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleting an Insight attribute that is used in a custom field search filtering causes search errors

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access your Insight schema > Select an object type
# Create an Insight Attribute called "Delete Me".
# Access your custom field configuration for a field of Insight type and add the above attribute to "Allow search filtering by these attributes" (see print below)
# Go back to Insight and delete the attribute created on step one.
# Access a Jira ticket and try to look for an asset using that Insight field(from step 3).

 !filter.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to perform a search without any further issues.

h3. Actual Results
Once we delete the attribute within Insight, that does not remove the attribute from the field configuration and the search throws an error saying that Insight data could not be fetched:
{noformat}
Could not fetch Insight objects

Please refresh the page and try again!
{noformat}
 !error.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
Access your field configuration and remove any attributes from the filter that doesn't exist anymore.
fields.summary: Deleting an Insight attribute that is used in a custom field search filtering causes search errors

fields.description:
h4. Current behavior

Opsgenie has the ability to receive alerts coming from *New Relic* using the integration methods below:
 - [Integrate Opsgenie with New Relic (Legacy)|https://support.atlassian.com/opsgenie/docs/integrate-opsgenie-with-new-relic-legacy/]
 - [Integrate Opsgenie with New Relic (New)|https://support.atlassian.com/opsgenie/docs/integrate-opsgenie-with-new-relic-alerts-new/]

But this integration is meant only to receive information from New Relic.
h4. Suggestion

Add the ability to replicate ACKs on Opsgenie, on New Relic within the same integration

(We have something similar with the [JSM/JSW integrations|https://support.atlassian.com/opsgenie/docs/integrate-opsgenie-with-jira-service-management/], where you can transition issues according to the action executed on Opsgenie)
fields.summary: Ability to ACK alerts on New Relic with Opsgenie integration

fields.description:
Having the option to disable Service Requests, Incidents, Problems and/or Changes would be helpful. My organization will not use Incidents and Problems so disabling them so agents and customers don't see them would be helpful. Otherwise right now with them being enabled its is confusing.

 

[[See this post|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management/Remove-default-queues-in-ITSM-project/qaq-p/1553697?tempId=eyJvaWRjX2NvbnNlbnRfbGFuZ3VhZ2VfdmVyc2lvbiI6IjIuMCIsIm9pZGNfY29uc2VudF9ncmFudGVkX2F0IjoxNjMxMjg4NzA2Nzg0fQ%3D%3D]|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management/Remove-default-queues-in-ITSM-project/qaq-p/1553697?tempId=eyJvaWRjX2NvbnNlbnRfbGFuZ3VhZ2VfdmVyc2lvbiI6IjIuMCIsIm9pZGNfY29uc2VudF9ncmFudGVkX2F0IjoxNjMxMjg4NzA2Nzg0fQ%3D%3D]
fields.summary: Ability to disable queues

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

Currently, the agent view (issue view) layout is broken into four sections:
 * *Customer request form*
 * *Descriptions fields*
 * *Context fields*
 * *Show more (hidden when empty)*

(You can find more details about each section [here|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/what-are-the-different-sections-in-the-issue-view/].)

Any fields which the customer submits through the portal form, always appear at the *Customer request form* section i.e. at the top central panel. These fields cannot be moved to other sections.
h3. Suggestion:

Ability to move fields collected in “*Customer request form*” to other sections like *Context fields* or *Description fields* in Agent View (issue view) layout.
h3. Workaround:

There isn’t any good workaround for this.
fields.summary: Allow more customisation options to admin for Agent View (issue view) layout

fields.description:
Canned Responses is another ability to enhance the management of agents and reaction times to customer requests. This is standard in other ticketing systems. 

The ability for the service desk lead to be able to create canned responses and share them with service agents.

The ability for Jira users and agents to create their own canned responses specific to repeated requests. And share them with everyone.

the requirement for this is exacerbated by the inability to paste both images and text in together to replies. Having to do things in a piece meal way makes Jira appear very dated and affects efficiency .
fields.summary: Canned Responses in Service Management Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Recently, we already released migration feature from the legacy Insight Cloud to the new Insight app ( [Migrate Insight Cloud to Insight in Jira Service Management|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/migrate-insight-cloud-to-insight-in-jira-service-management/]) , but it doesn't support object schema file from Insight Server. 

h3. Suggested Solution

It will be great to allow to import from exported object schema file from Insight Server , or even from Insight Cloud once the [JSDCLOUD-9967|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-9967] feature released.

h3. Workaround
User need to export the objects per object type and import it.
fields.summary: Ability to import using Object Schema export file

fields.description:
After some research I did not find any possibility to customize the "create linked issue"-screen. I wanted to add an important field for "deadline" which is really useful for Service-Desk when there is a connection to the development-team.

Is there really no possibility?
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-65760?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel

I hope for an answer as soon as possible.

Best Regards !image-2021-09-10-09-12-47-079.png|width=714,height=812!
fields.summary: Customize "Create linked Issue" Screenmask

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently at new issue view, the field layout is not consistent when issue created via JIRA or Portal. When creating from JIRA , all the field will display at the right side of the screen. However, when creating from the portal , it displays in the middle of the screen if the request form have the field configured.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make it consistent. Always display it at the right side of the screen or provide admin options to set the field layout.

h3. Why this is important
User will consistently looking at the field at the same place. 

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Field layout for "New issue view" should be the same when issue created via JIRA or Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Failing to create tickets at customer portal due to required field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access project settings > Field Configuration
# Make any custom field "Required"
# Go to the custom field configuration and look for that same field
# Change its context to be available only for "Incident" Issue Type
# Go to your customer portal and try to raise a ticket using a form that is tied to any other Issue type besides "Incident"

h3. Expected Results
The ticket should be created just fine since it's not available in that Issue Type context.

h3. Actual Results
When we submit the ticket no errors are thrown on UI, but at the browser console the following error is thrown:
{noformat}
Response: 400 Bad Request
"errorMessage": "Please provide a value for required field 'XYZ'",
{noformat}

h3. Notes 
* The issue seems to be intermittent
* I also managed to reproduce the issue just by making the field required and then hidden the field

h3. Workaround
* Make the field available under the field configuration(show) and then mark as optional
fields.summary: Failing to create tickets at customer portal due to required field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Customers can restrict the object type but once the user has access, all objects are visible.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users restricting objects
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Allow users restricting objects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an Insight import is attempted where the root object type is configured with "Pass all attributes to child object types." and you attempt to update the attributes configuration in the imports configuration, then we see an error. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an import configuration that imports a list of objects 
 # Click "Create predefined Insight structure" and close the dialog once it's completed
 # Go to your schema and click configure on the root object type that was created from step 2
 # Go to the Inheritance tab and check "Pass all attributes to child object types."
 # Go back to your import configuration and click "Create predefined Insight configuration"
 # Attempt to update one of the object type attributes of the referenced object in the imports configuration, ie. add a description or Object Mapping (IQL)

h3. Expected Results

Updates successfully and import source is refreshed
h3. Actual Results

The field updates but there is an error thrown
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Updating object type attribute configuration on an Insight import leads to an error when object type is configured with "Pass all attributes to child object types"

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, "Assign Issue" action will follow the assignee list provided. However, there are case , user want to change the assignee to a different assignee , but the existing assignee are part of the list. This causing the assignee are not changed.

h3. Suggestion
Add an exception assignee when the action trigger. It will be great too if the exception supports smart value.

h3. Workaround
Create multiple if/else condition and create a different assignee list for each "Assign Issue" action.
fields.summary: Ability to set skip condition for "Assign Issue" action

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
Currently, on the 'Requests' menu on the customer portal, there are two options 'Created by Me', 'Approvals'and 'All'. While the 'Create by me' is self-explanatory, the 'All' option could be labelled more meaningfully -- E.g: All Requests where you are participant

 !image-2021-09-09-16-41-28-602.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Feedback on the 'Created by me' and 'All' options on the Requests menu on the Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to filter by status in the JSM customer portal the filtered issues are not the right ones. 

Considering the status filtering is not available in the server version of JSM it would not have the underlying data available to support the feature at this time.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have your JSM project created from JSM server data
 # In the JSM customer portal select a status to filter by

h3. Expected Results

The correct filtered issue show up.
h3. Actual Results

No issues show up in the customer portal.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround as of yet.
fields.summary: JSM portal filtering working incorrectly for migrated licenses

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
Currently, the Insight dropdown menu (from the menubar) only shows the "How to get started" image and o the "View all object schema" and the "Insight Configuration" link. It will be great to be able to list and show all available Insight object schema on this menu for more convenient access to the schemas.

!Screen Shot 2021-09-09 at 15.19.25.png!

h3. Suggestion
It will be best to be able to show a list of Insight object schemas on the Insight dropdown menu for more convenient access to the relevant schemas for the users.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to show all Insight object schemas from the Insight drop down menu

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we land on /jira/servicedesk/projects/\{projectKey}/queues, we redirect the agent to the last visited queue and last visited category (which is stored in browser local storage). In case the agent does not have the last visited queue we fallback to the first queue based on order attribute which could end up picking queue in Other category
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make a fresh login in a different browser where there was no session made earlier
 # Now, open your Service Project
 # You would see that agents are seeing the first queue from the Other Queues section.

h3. Expected Results

We need to pick the queue from the group with the following precedence
 *Starred Queues → Team Priority Queues → Other Queues*
h3. Actual Results

Agents see the first queue from the Other Queue section.
h3. Workaround

No workaround for the new sessions but the agent can star their desired queue so that in the next login the system could pick it from the browser storage
fields.summary: Queues pages should land to first Team Priority queue or Starred Queue if no Last Visited Queue is present

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to use the Affected Services system field on the Filter Issue Scope IQL, even though that field is in sync with the default Services (SVC) Object Schema present in every instance.

It'd be beneficial to use that field on the IQL to filter out objects that have Object Attributes pointed to the SVC Object Schema
fields.summary: Add ability to use the "Affected Services" on the Filter Issue Scope IQL for Insight Objects fields

fields.description:
We are unable to differentiate between the request types under "Service requests" and "Incidents" at the Customer Portal. For example, I have "G-Suite" as a request type under both "Service requests" and "Incidents" but on the dropdown list, it doesn't differentiate between the both as shown in the screenshot below.

!image.png|thumbnail!

This is an essential feature that should be available at the customer portal hence I appreciate if Atlassian can implement this feature.
fields.summary: Suggest to differentiate between "Service requests" and "Incidents" Request Types on Customer Portal Filters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

ITSM project provide not editable (add, reduce, etc) default request types (Service requests, Incidents, Problems, Changes) 
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide functionality to edit the default request types
fields.summary: Unable to edit the request type in ITSM template

fields.description:
h3. *Current behavior*

The ability to add attachments to Objects was [released recently|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2021/09/atlassian-cloud-changes-aug-30-to-sep-6-2021], but as attachments are not considered an attribute, we can’t interact with them via Automation.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add the ability to copy attachments from issues to Objects via Automation.
fields.summary: Ability to copy attachments to Object via Automation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The group membership by default in the user management CSV export is separated by a comma(,). However, the Insight import engine expects the multiple values to be separated with the pipe symbol '||'.

The customer needs to update the CSV file generated from user management to separate the multiple values with the pipe symbol '||'. The Jira user import feature in the Insight Server/Datacenter is very easy and automatic. The need to update the file again to import group membership in the JSM cloud adds to the manual work to import the Jira users.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the user export generated from user management into Insight import directly. 
h3. Workaround

Update the CSV file generated from user management to separate the multiple values with pipe symbol '||'
fields.summary: Allow the user export generated from user management into Insight import directly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sometimes, due to misconfiguration, an email sent by JSM customer is processed by Jira email handler instead of JSM mail handler(using IMAP) and the mails are rejected. As a result of it, the mail handler adds a deleted flag against that email. 
Now, even if the customer marks the email as "Unread", the emails are not picked up by JSM mail handler as the Deleted flag is set
h3.  Solution
There should be an ability to remove the Deleted flag that has been set by the Jira default handler so that mails can be re-processed by JSM mail handler when they are marked as "Unread"

h3. Workaround
Ask the customer to resend the email again
fields.summary: Allow the re-processing of emails by JSM Mail handler that have been rejected by Global Jira mail handler
Teste

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Link the Insight object to Jira issues using the Automation or CSV import method, it updates the Insight object in the issue successfully but doesn't update the Jira issue in *Connected Jira issues* at the Insight object end.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to update the Insight object in the Jira issue using the Automation rule or by doing a CSV import 

h3. Expected Results

The Jira issue should be displayed in the "Connected Jira issues" section of the Insight object.
h3. Actual Results

These issues are not displayed even though the object is linked to the Jira issue.

 
h3. Workaround

No workaround at this moment.
h3. Notes

Customers following this kb to automatically link issue-object history are affected by this bug: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/workarounds-to-automatically-link-the-insight-object-to-jira-issues-1079345661.html]
fields.summary: Issues linked to an object with Automation or CSV Import do not reflect on the Connected Issues section of the object

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When creating/editing a page in Confluence, it is possible to add a caption to an image. This caption will be displayed when viewing the page in Confluence but does not display when viewed as an article in the customer portal.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to display image captions for articles in the customer portal
fields.summary: Ability to display image captions for articles in the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation for Jira's conditions are not working properly towards the JSM field *Affected services*.



h3. Steps to Reproduce

*1.* Scenario 1
* Set an *if/else* -> *issue fields condition*, using the option *is one of*
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-30 at 10.31.52 (1).png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-08-30 at 10.31.57 (1).png|thumbnail! 
* Create an issue, selecting 2 affected services (on that case, the services are *s1* and *s2*)

*2.* Scenario 2
* Use the condition specific to the *Affected services* field
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-30 at 10.12.30 (1).png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-08-30 at 10.12.38 (1).png|thumbnail! 
* Create an issue with two affected services (on that case, again, *s1* and *s2*)

h3. Expected Results

* *Scenario 1:* the issue will pass on both conditions since there are two affected services
* *Scenario 2:* the issue will pass on both conditions since there are two affected services

h3. Actual Results

* *Scenario 1:* the issue passes only on the second condition
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-30 at 10.32.09 (1).png|thumbnail! 
* *Scenario 2:* the issues passes only on the second condition
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-30 at 10.12.52 (1).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Using the *Advanced compare condition* seems to be working:
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-02 at 14.11.06.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-09-02 at 14.10.58.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-02 at 14.11.28.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Automation for Jira's conditions are not working well with the field Affected services

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight imports do not work sometimes "Insight is about to upgrade to a new version"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to initiate an Insight import (not reproducible on all cloud sites)

h3. Expected Results
The import starts executing.

h3. Actual Results
Import does not start due to the error "Insight is about to upgrade to a new version":
  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Every time we are releasing anything new to Insight cloud the imports will not start until the update is applied. It can take around 2-4 minutes to apply the update. 

h3. Workaround
Contact Atlassian support if you cannot perform the import after 10 minutes.
fields.summary: Insight imports do not work sometimes "Insight is about to upgrade to a new version"

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, admin not able to combine "Average Rating" report series with other series in one report.

h3. Suggestion
Allow admin to combine "Average Rating" series with other series in one report.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to combine "Average Rating" series report with other series

fields.description:
It would be great if a warning would be prompted to the user when he tries to add a mandatory field other than Summary and Description to the request type associated with the mail channel.

At this moment, you simply are unable to update the field requirement, a warning would be better.
fields.summary: Warns the user about mandatory fields in email request type

fields.description:
When filtering issues on the Customer Portal, you are able to filter by who created the ticket, the ticket Status and the ticket Request Type. However this filters will have statuses and request types of all tickets to which a user would have access too - in all projects:
{quote}!image-2021-09-01-14-59-16-395.png!
{quote}
This can cause problems for customers with several projects and request types, as the options on the drop-down menu are limited and one would have to search for the desired request type. Having those tickets filtered by project, before all else, would get the interface to be more friendly for service customers.
fields.summary: Ability to see all requests per project on the Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Some users would like to designate several email addresses on their customer account, so that when they log in with the different accounts in the customer portal, they will be able to view all the tickets created using the customer account.
h3. Suggested Solution

The user that is logged in using their personal account can also access issues addressed to the customer account without having to log in with the customer account.
fields.summary: Allow multiple email addresses to be associated with a single customer account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Agents don't get some internal notification when the agent is in JSM organization and the internal notification is configured to send notification to project role like "Service Desk Team".
This is partially fixed at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3410, but still there is a case that agents don't get internal notification. It's been fixed to treat watchers and assignee as agents in JSDCLOUD-3410. However when an issue is created, it’s not possible to send internal notification to agents as there is no watcher and assignee at the time.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# add a user to a project as "Service Desk Team" role
#*  !image-2021-09-01-17-27-02-645.png|thumbnail! 
# add the agent to a JSM organization
#*  !image-2021-09-01-17-28-27-217.png|thumbnail! 
# configure the internal notification to send notification to Agent role users.
#*  !image-2021-09-01-17-31-04-285.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The user get the internal notification.

h3. Actual Results
The user doesn't get the internal notification.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JSM agents don't get some internal notification when the agent is in JSM organization.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

JSM admins cannot organize the paths for knowledge base articles to be the same as configured in Confluence. 

 Path shown in Confluence:
 !image-2021-09-01-16-13-09-991.png|width=500!

Path shown in JSM Customer portal:
 !image-2021-09-01-16-13-34-031.png|width=500!
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to allow JSM admins to display the same paths for Customer Portal KB articles and Confluence pages.
To be able to import the paths from Confluence to JSM Customer Portal will allow better navigation of knowledge base articles. 

h3. Workaround
This could be partially be configured manually by using [categorization of knowledge base articles|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/categorize-knowledge-base-articles/|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/categorize-knowledge-base-articles/], but manual labor is required and there are limitations such as [subcategories|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-8208] not being allowed as of now.
fields.summary: Add the ability to allow JSM admins to display the same paths for Customer Portal KB articles and Confluence pages.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is functionality in JSM where ITSM templates are affecting Opsgenie. It adds any users who access a project with ITSM template in JSD as a stakeholder to Opsgenie. There is no way to disable this option and there appears to be no documentation about this issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an standalone Enterprise Opsgenie 
 # Have JSM in the same site
 # JSM creates free Stakeholder accounts on Opsgenie if they are part of an ITSM project

h4. Expected Results

If we delete these Stakeholders out of Opsgenie, they shouldn't keep getting invited back to that OG instance
h3. Actual Results

JSM keeps inviting these users to OG
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. JSM keeps inviting users to Opsgenie as Stakeholders even if they get deleted on the OG side
fields.summary: Ability to stop JSM from creating Stakeholders on a Standalone Opsgenie

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to hide hidden request types from "My requests" tab of the portal
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to request types under a project and hide a request type
 # Navigate to portal> requests > my requests ( we will be able to search for the hidden request type)

h3. Expected Results

Navigate to portal> requests > my requests (we shouldn't be able to see actual request type)
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to hide hidden request types from "My requests" tab of the portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, JSM are allowing integration with Halp. For example issue transitioning from Halp. However, in the Customer Portal , customer will get notified that the issue was transitioned by Halp , which is make customer are confused , who are Halp? 

Due to Halp account is a system add on account, site admin will not have option to edit the display name.

h3. Suggestion
It will be great if the site admin is able to change the system add-on display name ; Or JSM have the option to set a default name for add on account that performing action in JSM. 

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability admin to change system add on display name , eg Halp
